headline.print_headline: N.C.A.A. Limits on Personnel Loom for Programs in the SEC
headline.main: Limits Loom for Staffs of the SEC

docs.snippet: The displays at Southeastern Conference practices, with dozens of staff members scurrying around, may not go on for much longer, with N.C.A.A. legislation on strength coaches to take effect Aug. 1....
docs.abstract: NCAA legislation limiting a team's strength and conditioning staff to five coaches is set to take effect August 1; some team in the Southeastern Conference, which has produced the last six national champions, currently have as many as 12 assistants.
docs.lead_paragraph: The displays at Southeastern Conference practices, with dozens of staff members scurrying around, may not go on for much longer, with N.C.A.A. legislation on strength coaches to take effect Aug. 1.

docs.snippet: Internet courses are monologues. True learning is a dialogue....
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Mark Edmundson questions the quality of the education that Internet courses can provide; contends online courses can never match the classroom experience, particularly because learning is most effective when it is a collaboration between teacher and students.
docs.lead_paragraph: Internet courses are monologues. True learning is a dialogue.

headline.print_headline: Working or Playing Indoors, New Yorkers Face an Unabated Roar
headline.seo: In New York City, Indoor Noise Goes Unabated
headline.main: Working or Playing Indoors, New Yorkers Face an Unabated Roar

docs.snippet: Noise measurements at 37 restaurants, bars, stores and gyms across the city showed, according to experts, potentially dangerous conditions at one-third of them....
docs.abstract: Loud noise has become a fact of life across New York in the very places where people have traditionally sought respite from urban stress; noise levels at 37 restaurants, bars, stores and gyms were found to border on dangerous at one-third of them; some research has shown that people drink more and chew faster when exposed to loud music and quick tempos. (Series: What?)

byline.contributor: Emily S. Rueb and Josh Williams contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: Noise measurements at 37 restaurants, bars, stores and gyms across the city showed, according to experts, potentially dangerous conditions at one-third of them.

headline.print_headline: Luck Is Signed by the Colts
headline.seo: Luck Is Signed by the Colts
headline.main: Luck Is Signed by the Colts

docs.snippet: The Indianapolis Colts signed Andrew Luck, the Stanford quarterback and No. 1 overall pick in the N.F.L. draft, to a four-year, $22.1 million deal....
docs.abstract: Indianapolis Colts sign quarterback Andrew Luck to a four-year, $22.1 million contract; other football news noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Indianapolis Colts signed Andrew Luck, the Stanford quarterback and No. 1 overall pick in the N.F.L. draft, to a four-year, $22.1 million deal.

headline.print_headline: Sylvia Woods, Soul-Food Restaurateur, Is Dead at 86
headline.main: Sylvia Woods, Soul-Food Restaurateur, Is Dead at 86

docs.snippet: Ms. Woods’s namesake Harlem soul-food restaurant was frequented by local and national politicians, international celebrities, tourists, epicures and ordinary neighborhood residents....
docs.abstract: Sylvia Woods, soul-food restaurateur who opened her famous namesake Harlem restaurant in 1962, dies at age 86.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Woods’s namesake Harlem soul-food restaurant was frequented by local and national politicians, international celebrities, tourists, epicures and ordinary neighborhood residents.

headline.print_headline: Judge Tells Apple to Advertise a Win for Samsung
headline.seo: Judge Tells Apple to Advertise Legal Win for Samsung
headline.main: Judge Tells Apple to Advertise a Win for Samsung

docs.snippet: The ruling by a British judge is the latest twist in a global legal battle over patents between bitter rivals in the smartphone and tablet businesses....
docs.abstract: Eric Pfanner Advertising column observes a British judge has ordered Apple to post notices on its Web site and to take out newspaper ads declaring that Samsung did not infringe Apple design patents; points out the ruling is the latest twist in a global legal battle over patents between bitter rivals in the smartphone and tablet businesses.
docs.lead_paragraph: The ruling by a British judge is the latest twist in a global legal battle over patents between bitter rivals in the smartphone and tablet businesses.

headline.print_headline: A Hunt for Split-Ticket Voters In a Tight Virginia Senate Race
headline.seo: In Tight Virginia Senate Race, Seeking Every Edge
headline.main: A Hunt for Split-Ticket Voters in a Tight Virginia Senate Race

docs.snippet: For former Gov. Tim Kaine and ex-Senator George Allen, the search for people who say their vote for senator is not tied to their vote for president has become imperative....
docs.abstract: Tight Senate race in Virgina between former Gov Tim Kaine, a Democrat, and ex-Senator George Allen, a Republican, may hinge on the search for people who say their vote for senator is not tied to their vote for president; state appears deadlocked between President Obama and Mitt Romney and neither candidate wants his fate dependent on his party’s presidential standard-bearer. (Series: New Dominion)
docs.lead_paragraph: For former Gov. Tim Kaine and ex-Senator George Allen, the search for people who say their vote for senator is not tied to their vote for president has become imperative.

headline.seo: Bloody Nose in Boxing Leads to Arrest

docs.snippet: Martin Tucker won his latest boxing match, but a bloody nose in the ring could send him to prison for bank robbery....
docs.abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation links boxer Martin Tucker to 2009 bank robbery in Temperance, Mich, through bloody swab obtained during his latest bout; Tucker is arrested and is being held without bond.
docs.lead_paragraph: Martin Tucker won his latest boxing match, but a bloody nose in the ring could send him to prison for bank robbery.

docs.snippet: Turkey must atone for its own past crimes before lecturing others on human rights....

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Taner Akcam welcomes Turkish Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan's denunciation of the Syrian government's massacre of civilians, but notes that it is remarkably hypocritical given Turkey's denial of crimes committed against non-Turks in the early 1900s; contends Turks must atone for past sins before accusing others of genocide.
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey must atone for its own past crimes before lecturing others on human rights.
